headline: What Berkshire Hathaway (BRK.A)'s Potential Kraft Heinz Exit Means For Shareholders
summary: Earlier in January 2026, Kraft Heinz disclosed in an SEC filing that Berkshire Hathaway, now led by CEO Greg Abel, may sell up to its entire 325,442,152-share stake, potentially ending a decade-long investment Warren Buffett helped create through the 2015 Kraft–Heinz merger. This possible full exit marks a rare reversal of a high-profile Buffett-era deal and offers an early signal of how Abel may reshape Berkshire’s portfolio and capital allocation priorities.
